quest.name: Spear of the Fearless
journal: Guildmaster Ywain would teach you the meaning of courage.
Guildmaster Ywain bids you go to the Central Shroud and slay riverbank yarzons. Use the sack of foul-smelling bait he has provided to lure the creatures from their nest.
You have successfully defeated the riverbank yarzons. Report back to Ywain at the Lancers' Guild.
Upon returning to the guild, Ywain bids you slay unspecified fiends in the Central Shroud. Investigate three collapsed pillars near Spirithold, and put down whatever creatures appear.
You have successfully defeated the creatures at the collapsed pillars. Report back to Jillian at the Lancers' Guild.

Back at the guild, you encounter a mysterious lancer who seems intent on acquainting you with the dangerous end of his spear. Just when it seems that bloodshed is inevitable, the unknown intruder chooses to withdraw, leaving you to ponder his parting words. Perhaps Ywain can shed some light on this incident.

According to Ywain, it is not uncommon for rogue lancers to challenge members of the guild. He tells you to pay the uninvited guest no further heed, and to focus instead on preparing for the coming trial.

※The next lancer quest will be available from Ywain upon reaching level 10.
objectives: Use foul-smelling bait to lure out riverbank yarzons and slay them.
Report to Ywain at the Lancers' Guild.
Slay the creatures at the collapsed pillars.
Report to Jillian at the Lancers' Guild.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, you have returned. I take from your presence that you have gained a measure of familiarity with your weapon. Good. You are ready to begin the next phase of your training.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: You will recall my telling you that it takes no small amount of courage to be a lancer. Now, in general terms, “courage” is the strength to do something which one finds unnerving.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: However, a lancer's notion of courage is not so simple. Having first drawn a distinction between courage and recklessness, he then divides the former into two aspects. I would have you learn each with spear in hand.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: The first is composure.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: When outnumbered in battle, a lancer may lose his composure and succumb to panic. Should this happen, all of his training will swiftly flee his mind, and he will struggle to overcome opponents whom he would ordinarily have bested with ease. He will, in short, contribute to his own defeat.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: If you wish to become a lancer in sooth, you must learn to maintain your composure at all times. Do this and you will be able to call upon every onze of your strength and skill when it matters most. And so to your first task...

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: The riverbanks of the Central Shroud are home to vilekin known as yarzons. Fiercely territorial, the creatures will attack anyone who strays too close, making them the bane of fisherfolk.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: They typically fall upon their prey en masse, barring all avenues of escape before closing in for the kill.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: What must go through the mind of their victim in that instant? Panic? Despair? Be sure to tell me upon your return. Needless to say, I would have you brave such an encounter. Take this sack of decidedly noisome bait, and use it to lure the ever-ravenous creatures out of their nest.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: It may be that only one curious yarzon appears, but what if two or three follow the scent...? Let us see how you fare then.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Go now, my young lancer, and learn what it means to fight with composure.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename, and well done. I trust you now understand that in times of direst need, no amount of strength or skill with a spear will avail the lancer who lacks composure.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: You are now ready to learn the second aspect of a lancer's courage: resolve.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: When faced with a terrible foe, a lancer may succumb to fear and self-doubt. Should this happen, he will become defensive, and in seeking to cover his weakness, surrender his greatest strength─namely, his capacity to attack.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: A lancer who fears to attack is naught but a man holding a pole. His spear may as well be a broomstick for all the good it would do him. It is not and will never be a shield.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: That you may learn the truth of my words firsthand, I bid you go to the Central Shroud, to an area adjoining the abandoned dungeon known as Spirithold.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Since the Calamity, that neck of the Twelveswood has become a veritable menagerie of fearsome fauna.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: There you will find three collapsed pillars, which have become a haunt for fell creatures. You are to put them down.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Hm? What manner of fiends can you expect to encounter? Hah! To reveal that would be to defeat the purpose of the lesson, my young lancer.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: I will say only this: if you face these foes with a lancer's resolve, you will surely emerge the victor.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Once you have completed the trial, pray report to Jillian in the entrance hall.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: She has grasped the two aspects of courage, albeit with some trouble. Though I doubt you will encounter similar difficulties, her struggle has furnished her with certain insights which I think you would benefit from hearing.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: A lancer learns best when he is doing, aye, but the wisdom of his seniors is not entirely without worth. Go now, Forename, and do as I bid you.

dialogue.name: JILLIAN
dialogue.text: I have been expecting you, Forename. By your return, I trust you now understand the importance of resolve.

dialogue.name: JILLIAN
dialogue.text: Like one's flesh, courage can be made strong. It is a matter of training each of its aspects.

dialogue.name: JILLIAN
dialogue.text: Now, the endeavor may prove difficult in the beginning─gods know how much I struggled. You may suffer untold humiliation and more frustration than you can bear...but you must persevere.

dialogue.name: JILLIAN
dialogue.text: Whenever you engage an opponent, whether in training or in earnest, make a conscious effort to fight with composure and resolve. Over time, doing so will become second nature, and you will acquire such courage as you never thought could be yours.

dialogue.name: JILLIAN
dialogue.text: Mind you, not all battles entail a physical clash of might. It could simply be a disagreement born of a conflict in ideology.

dialogue.name: JILLIAN
dialogue.text: The point is, it matters not what battlefield you stand upon. So long as you take care to be composed and resolute, your courage will grow.

dialogue.name: JILLIAN
dialogue.text: ...Did that make any sense? Even a little? I fear I cannot hold a candle to Guildmaster Ywain, but if there is aught I can do to assist in your training─

dialogue.name: JILLIAN
dialogue.text: What was that? Something is afoot in the training area...

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)And you call yourselves lancers? Pathetic...

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)You are next, Guildmaster. Arm yourself and face me.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)Refuse, and all will know that you are no true lancer.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Say what you will. I am above provocation.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)Hmph... Craven to the last man...

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)Ah, but what have we here?

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Wait. SheHe is but a novice.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)That makes no odds to me. You yourself admitted herhim to your ranks, did you not?

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)Very well. I shall withdraw for now.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)Yet know that only the fearless are fit to wear the mantle of lancer.

dialogue.name: FOULQUES
dialogue.text: (-???-)I look forward to measuring your worth in the days to come.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: There is naught more to see. Return to your drills!

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Forename. You made no attempt to evade his thrust.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Did your opponent so unnerve you as to deprive you of your senses?

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Well, it is of little consequence now.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: You need pay no further heed to our uninvited guest. Lest you wonder, it is not uncommon for challengers to come pounding on our door, seeking to test their mettle.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: For now, dedicate yourself to tempering the two aspects of courage: the composure to bring the sum of your strength and skill to bear against your foes...

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: ...and the resolve to attack when fear would stay your hand, as befits a lancer.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: When next we meet, I shall have another trial for you─one that will put your courage to the test.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Until then, continue to apply yourself to your training. Farewell, Forename.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You feel a ravenous gaze!
